intro: Adicea cephalantha, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, low-growing shrub form with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Adicea cephalantha thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
